Negative Reviews:
Location is great- very close to the airport.  The staff is friendly and incredibly helpful.  The manager Paola, went above and beyond to help me with a location for something I needed. (There could have been better quality bath towels (size and softness/thickness could have been much better but the bathroom was very clean.  Good hot shower. 
Breakfast was good (considering covid protocols) It was the usual continental, but thankfully not the 'breakfast in a bag' as other hotels do. Good hot coffee and a variety of juices.  Comfortable and clean lobby area. Chic design.  Spacious seating.  
Overall, a very good stay for an airport hotel!

Review Title: Nice stay, Awesome Staff, Needs some upgrades!
Negative Reviews: So, the hotel is nice, but some upgrades would elevate the experience, especially considering that it is in the city with the biggest cruising port in the world. The breakfast lacked variety and was just okay. The breakfast sausages could be switched up with bacon or turkey sausage for some variety, add some breakfast potatoes, grits, biscuits, sausage gravy, danishes, maybe. The laundry facility has older coin operated machines, but the room does not have a change machine and the front desk didn't have any quarters. Monthly maintenance checks/repairs would catch minor problems that detract from the customer experience (the wallpaper in our bathroom was peeling near the bathtub, the sound on our TV was wonky).
Positive Reviews: First of all, the staff was awesome! The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping kept our room clean and comfortable and made sure the common areas were always clean. The pool area was clean and inviting with plenty of seating and shady areas to relax. The business area was very comfortable for sitting and the computer and printer were free to use. Our room was nice and the beds were very comfy. The free WIFI worked well. The location is just 15-20 minutes away from the port. The price (when booked early) was reasonable.
Room Type: Queen Room with Two Queen Beds - Non-Smoking

Review Title: Reasonably priced. Convenient shuttle to and from airport and/or cruise port.
Negative Reviews: I did not like that I called for the shuttle from the airport, was told it would be about 15 minutes.  One came but said he was full and that another would be by in 10 minutes and we would need to wait.  After 15 minutes I called the hotel again requesting a shuttle since one did not come back.  I was told it would be 20-25 minutes! In total we waited over an hour to finally get a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, which was only about 15 minutes away!  I appreciate that it was no charge but didn't appreciate how long we had to wait at the airport after traveling most of the day.  Also, our room on the surface appeared clean until I decided I wanted ice.  When I grabbed the ice bucket, I found the previous guests' keys in it!  Apparently they had been calling for a few days asking if the hotel had found their keys! So someone not only does not do a thorough job cleaning but also does not do a thorough job of checking for items left from a previous guest practically in plain sight!
Positive Reviews: The location was good, meaning it was close to the airport as well as close to the shipping port.  I chose this hotel because we were going on a cruise. I still feel like they should keep the carpet vacuumed during the remodeling. There were places where it looked like throw up, but was really dirt. Not a great 1st impression. The room was clean, but  a little shabby for the price point, but hopefully it will be included in the remodel. The bus to the Port was late. We ended up taking an Uber. I asked several times if the bus would get us there by 12pm and was assured it would. We left at 1210pm and it still was not there. There were at least 50 people waiting for it so by the time everyone and their luggage was loaded there was no way it would be there on time. Most of the staff were very nice and helpful. The young lady working the overnight shift was not pleasant or helpful.  She seemed to not want to be disturbed as she was in the back.

On checkout trying to catch the 7am shuttle to airport I didn't see anyone and called front desk to enquire. A shuttle appeared across the other side of the road not over to me considering I had 4 pieces of luggage 🧳 2 large suitcases luckily they all rollovers. I couldn't help but read the drivers face he looked upset like maybe he had to turn back for me or something. I wouldn't intentionally inconvenience persons otherwise I might have tried to get Uber or taxi. Nevertheless I am grateful I got on to make airport early enough to get my international 10 am flight. The driver unloaded everyone including my luggage I said thank you  to him and he just looked at me like I was the lowest species.  I'm not asking him to smile and kiss my feet I just wanted him to know I appreciated his service and trouble he probably had just to come and pick me up. But I just felt he seemed prejudiced towards me. 

Property can contend with the 4 and 5 stars.

Review Title: Definitely one of the better airport hotels!
Negative Reviews:
Location is great- very close to the airport.  The staff is friendly and incredibly helpful.  The manager Paola, went above and beyond to help me with a location for something I needed. The rooms are decent size, very clean and the beds are very comfortable. I slept very well! (There could have been better quality bath towels (size and softness/thickness could have been much better but the bathroom was very clean.  Good hot shower. 
Breakfast was good (considering covid protocols) It was the usual continental, but thankfully not the 'breakfast in a bag' as other hotels do. Good hot coffee and a variety of juices.  Comfortable and clean lobby area. Chic design.  Spacious seating.  
Overall, a very good stay for an airport hotel!

Review Title: You get what you pay for (sometimes not even that).
Negative Reviews:
1. Advance communication regarding the shuttle times was lacking (couldn't tell me until the day prior what the shuttle times were).
2. Room wasn't ready. When checking in a family of 4 to a room with only a king bed, the staff member knew we needed to use the pull-out bed (I asked if another room was available and he said ours had a pull-out, so we should be fine), but neglected to provide any bedding. Had to make 2 separate trips to the lobby: one for the bed sheets and another for a pillow (didn't have any on-hand behind the desk). 
3. Since we arrived very late due to flight delays, my wife and kids went straight to bed (it was 4am). I requested the pillows, and had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. The attendant brought it up and I waited by the door for a gentle knock, which never came. Instead, several minutes later he chose to call our room to announce he had pillows. The super loud hotel phone woke everyone up - my wife, and my 3- and 6-year-old exhausted kids. I went back down to the lobby for the pillows to be told he didn't knock because of the sign on the door. So instead of the gentle knocking (acceptable), he called our room, which was 10x louder and more intrusive. And it required my second trip to the office.
4. Finally, the shuttle driver had no customer service skills. His personal interactions were unprofessional, curt, and difficult to understand. There were supposed to be 2 shuttle runs that morning: 11:30am and 12:30pm. As of 12pm, the 11:30 shuttle was still sitting there. We were scheduled for 12:30pm to make port by 1pm, and thankfully were able to join the earlier run (they ended up only doing 1 run).
Positive Reviews: Location was fine. Close proximity to the airport. There were a few nearby breakfast options (IHOP, McDonald's) which we did not experience due to time constraints. The hotel offered a free shuttle to the port, which was the main factor in choosing the property.

Upon arriving we were told there would be no more room on a shuttle to the cruise port. Because of this we had to pay $60 on an Uber.  There was also no gf option for my son for breakfast.   It could be a super easy fix to just have an allergen friendly cereal option.  As for the shuttle, they should change the way it was advertised. Negative Reviews:
From start to finish this overnight was chaos. Upon arriving at Miami airport, I was told to call the hotel so that they can send the shuttle bus (with a foreign phone, this would cost me a fortune so I had to borrow a phone from a stranger at the airport and was told to wait 40mins for the bus). What kind of system is this for foreigners arriving from all over the world and using this airport hotel? Same the day after, I came down to get the bus back to the airport and was told it's every hour, yet there is no information on this displayed anywhere or sent via email anywhere. They can order me a taxi was the suggestion the uninterested morning male receptionist told me. The issue is that they share the bus with 3 other hotels so have no control over it.
The AC made noise all night in the room so if you're a light sleeper, this is not the place for you.
Hair on the shower floor as well.
Not an ideal experience when overnighting.

Negative Reviews: The only thing I like about the service was Amanda. When I first got there to check-in, this heavy set guy behind the counter failed to confirm my reservation. As I stood at the counter he proceeded to tell me that my name was on this list. He failed to verify my phone number on this waiting list. He did not tell me that I needed to go on it. He assumed that I was part of the group with the same last name.  He just assumed that my name was the same name as the one on the list and that I would be called. Well. I was never called for my reservation and I almost didn't get a reservation and my name was almost not even put on the list. I had to get stern with the employee and told him this is unexcusable for the service. As I bantered with Amanda that this was unfair treatment, she got on it and went beyond the call of duty and got us checked in. The guy who so called put me on the wait list shrugged it off as no big deal. All this happened on June 17th,2023. Personally, I will not stay at this hotel again. We were tired from returning from a cruise vacation and the service from that gentleman who was supposedly have checked us In was poorly done. Worst customer service I've ever seen, but for Amanda, she made sure that we got our room so that we can rest. Please give her a raise.

Final room was OK, dirty duvet cover, had to wait an hour for fresh towels and unfortunately the maintenance and room attendants do not speak English.

4 USD is deducted from your account without explanation, the receptionist was very uninspiring and probably needs more training on general customer service.

No water in the rooms and at 5.45am I was woken up by a gathering of people having a party in the car park.

Generally the hotel is very unkempt, the carpets are atrocious.

Even for a 3 star, this hotel was not value for money.

Negative Reviews: We stayed there for one night for a cruise.  Your staff's instructions for waiting for the shuttle to take us to the cruiseport was confusing and frustrating. The shuttle did not arrive on time and was over 1 hour late.  Your hotel staff was unfriendly and unhelpful.  At one point, the entire staff left the desk and went into a small conference room adjacent to the front desk; leaving everyone wondering what to do.  Fortunately, we had family members wait downstairs just in case the shuttle pulled up.   I received a text from family saying the shuttle arrived and come downstairs.  If I hadn't got the text, I would have missed the shuttle cause YOUR STAFF KEPT TELLING PEOPLE TO WAIT UPSTAIRS IN THE LOBBY.   You need to get organized.  I won't stay here again.  Also, there's no places to eat.  The closest is a restaurant down the street and you have to walk along a busy highway to get to it.   Very dangerous.  We were frightened someone would get hit by a car because cars drove by so close to us.

They claim you could only be added to the list upon check in and it’s first come basis but they don’t tell you they only run three shuttles a day to the port. Review Title: Fine for one night, but not more! Will not book again.
Negative Reviews:
The breakfast wasn’t good. Very few choices and the food felt like it’s been sitting out the whole night. 

The staff was little to not helpful at all. One lady sat with her AirPods in during check-in and didn’t even notice when one guest was standing in front of her. And the man who was helping us check-in was all but ready to give up when he didn’t find our booking at first, instead of helping us. They didn’t smile once, not even the manager. 

The rooms were nice at first glance, but not clean at all. Our white socks was black underneath after awhile. It was quite frankly disgusting to walk on the floors. 

Wi-Fi was very bad. 

I forgot my glasses in the room when I checked out and when I called them to ask if they had them, they asked me to call again another day instead of checking right away. 

They also charged more money for a deposit than was listed in the terms of booking.

Negative Reviews:
The desk clerk for the night shift was very friendly, but was most likely resting in the employee room in the back when I needed him. I landed at 1 am and called the hotel from the airport 3 times to get the hotel shuttle to pick me up, but no one picked up. I ended up having to pay for a lyft to get to the hotel. 

I later called while at the lobby to check and the telephone was at the front desk, but of course the clerk was at the back and there was no one to check me in. I called out for him and ended up having to knock on the door for him to come out. After that though, he was extremely friendly and quickly granted me the late check-out I was requesting.

There is a communication and attitude problem with the other staff though. The cleaning lady was not notified I was checking out late and woke me up at 11 am through knocking, trying to open my door and calling out.

Then there was the alarm testing. At 10 am someone called my room to tell me there was alarm testing at 11, but I didn’t pick up because I was asleep. At 11, an extremely loud alarm came on and completely woke me up. You really can’t do this after the late check-out time at 12? After the cleaning lady’s knocks, it just felt like the hotel was trying to kick me out of the room. I called the front desk to ask what was going on and in a someone exasperated tone they told me they were testing the alarm in a “sorry not sorry” kind of way.

The room was clean and quiet for most of the night, but due to the experience I laid out above, I won’t be staying at this hotel again.

Review Title: Lesson learned! I really wish I had taken photos but was pretty nauseated by the condition of the flooring mostly!
Negative Reviews: I was told there was a 24 hr shuttle by reservation desk, it’s also stated on website. This isn’t true it only runs until 12 midnight therefore after our flight we had to pay a cab! When I questioned this, I was told a third party was told by “email” multiple times to change the 24 hr statement. There was also a 24 hr shuttle to cruise port…they don’t tell you there is a limit of times and passengers who must make a reservation, yeah! The carpets were disgusting and I mean years of filthy stains and bleach stains…nasty! The baseboards in hallways were equally disgusting…the room was dirty on the clean side considering the shape of the rest of the property. The staff really didn’t give a flip about your shuttle worries and it was apparent…anyways never again!
Positive Reviews: It was a great location, that’s about it!
